channel.title: Reading Data Directly from the Printer
channel.description:
Hey 0x00ers! I am new here. Is there any way to read data directly from the printer? I have full access to printers webinterface so I can change printer security settings too. Tried pret.py but got connection closed/timeout message.
model; d-copia_4000mf
Printer ip Protocol settings; https://pasteboard.co/IA0wK1K.png

item.title: Reading Data Directly from the Printer
item.dc:creator: riddix
item.description:
Yep, tried all of them with no result. Connection timeout. is there another way to get data? :s

Read full topic
item.source: Reading Data Directly from the Printer

item.title: Reading Data Directly from the Printer
item.dc:creator: yeezi
item.description:
PRET and Praeda provide frameworks for this. PRET works most of the time in my experience, but the extent of the module capabilities is hit-or-miss.

Did you make sure to try all the printer languages? PCL/PJL/PostScript? Depending on which one the printer supports, you can have the printer store print jobs in a buffer and them dump them to your local machine when you choose.

Read full topic
item.source: Reading Data Directly from the Printer
